context.p: You can filter an operation in the Open, On Hold and Complete page in the application based on the filter criteria you select. For example, you can filter all the operations in the Ready status for a work order.

step.cmd: In the Machines drop-down list box, select a machine.
step.stepresult: The Open page appears, displaying a list of operations for the selected machine.

step.cmd: Select for a field, and then select the filter options as described in the following table.

chrow.chdesc: Select to view the operations for all the fields.
Select to view the operation for a specific column. <operation_data> is the row value you select in a column for an operation.

chdesc.p: Enter a value in the Search box to search for an operation by the <operation_data> name. As you enter characters in the Search box, the field values list is automatically filtered to display only values that contain the search text.The matched field values are not case-sensitive. A message appears if no field value is available corresponding to the entered search text.

info.note: Select Cancel to delete your selections and go back to the previous page.

taskbody.result: The operations based on the specified filter criteria appear in the selected page and the filter indicator appears for the field. You can apply filters on multiple fields in a page to refine the filtered data. To clear a filter applied on a field, select for the field on which you want to remove the filter. Then, in the window containing the list of field values, clear the selected check boxes, and then select OK. You can also select to modify the applied filter on a field.
